question: What is a primary fear associated with the Root (Muladhara) Chakra?
answers: Fear of not surviving, fear of instability
short_explanation: The Root (Muladhara) Chakra is often linked to this fear.
long_explanation: The Root (Muladhara) Chakra governs aspects of psychological and energetic well-being. When imbalanced, it can manifest as 'Fear of not surviving, fear of instability', affecting both emotional and physical health. Awareness of these fears helps in energy-based healing modalities and self-reflection.
applied_example: A massage therapist using chakra-based techniques may incorporate grounding or heart-opening techniques depending on the client's fear tied to the Root (Muladhara) Chakra.
text: What is a primary fear associated with the Root (Muladhara) Chakra?
options: Fear of not surviving, fear of instability
correctAnswer: Fear of not surviving, fear of instability
abcd: D. Fear of not surviving, fear of instability
